content:
How to contact me:

• Signal/WhatsApp: +447376786842
• Email: ryan@rjgallagher.co.uk
• SecureDrop: https://t.co/2nQo5d7jNj
• PGP: https://t.co/cLvZdQ7YGb
• Snail mail: 133 Fountainbridge, Floor 7, Edinburgh, EH3 9QG

All whistleblowers, sources, tips welcome. No PR pitches.

New: A few years before a major hack disrupted operations at US disinfectant producer Clorox -- resulting in $400m+ sales losses & costs -- an audit warned of systemic cybersecurity flaws within the company’s manufacturing plants https://t.co/w1aiL2aHgl

New: A second US Senator has attacked Microsoft's operations in China, adding to a wave of criticism from human rights groups following a @BW investigation on the company censoring its Bing search engine to satisfy Beijing: https://t.co/axl1kSLYWp

US Senator @MarkWarner calls on Microsoft to consider pulling its search platform Bing out of China after our story revealing how it censors info on human rights & democracy. “US companies should not be facilitating PRC censorship," Warner says: https://t.co/Iie9UovZt9

New: Inside Microsoft's Bing search engine in China, which is censoring information on human rights, democracy, climate change & much more to satisfy China's authoritarian government: https://t.co/jmHL80SwYX

US senator @RonWyden calls for overhaul of telecom security & sanctions to curb foreign govs & private surveillance companies that he says are hacking mobile phone networks to secretly track Americans in the US & journalists & dissidents abroad: https://t.co/eDQa4XdPKG

US adds @Sandvine to blacklist that will effectively ban it from obtaining US technology; company enabled “mass web-monitoring & censorship to block news as well as target political actors and human rights activists”: https://t.co/TraS1qcFtj

US-Canadian tech company Sandvine developed controversial spy tool to help governments track encrypted Signal & WhatsApp messages. Recently quietly scrapped effort to sell to US agencies DEA & FBI after layoffs. Pitched product to govts across Europe, Middle East, Asia:…

Hack of Egyptian presidential candidate Ahmed Eltantawy's iPhone brings scrutiny to US-Canadian company Sandvine, whose "deep packet inspection" technology allegedly aided the delivery of spyware to his device earlier this year:  https://t.co/kTB32O5tKm

New research identifies NSO Group spyware campaign amid Azerbaijan-Armenia conflict; a dozen prominent figures in Armenia had iPhones hacked, including UN official, war crimes investigator, journalists, academics, a govt spokesperson. https://t.co/4sBSCRftHM

Four directors of German spyware firm FinFisher indicted over $5m deal to provide Turkey with tool used to hack government opponents; prosecutor says they tried to conceal sale via company in Bulgaria, violated export controls. Could face jail time. https://t.co/2riUX4VNLU

Twitter sued for allegedly helping to silence Saudi critics; suit claims Saudis targeted numerous dissidents by accessing Twitter’s confidential data via employees recruited as spies https://t.co/UgsNpPXDiG

I wrote about an Israeli company called Rayzone, which is using the advertising industry as a vehicle to collect vast amounts of data from mobile phones, then repurposing the data to help dozens of government agencies worldwide track people. https://t.co/2fpkLwCoTZ

I went to Ireland to hear about a horrific cyberattack on the country's hospitals, which unleashed chaos & risked lives. Spoke to two dozen people involved & tracked down an ex-member of the criminal gang responsible.

“We were plunged into darkness.”

https://t.co/ea8CpNgq9M

Ransomware gang Lockbit behind cyber incident affecting UK's @RoyalMail this week. Attack compromised dispatch systems that process international mail, has caused major disruption https://t.co/4aIOPkhZja

New: The work of two key teams that Twitter relied on to comply w/ data privacy protections in EU & US abruptly stopped amid a rash of layoffs, resignations & firings, which has put the social media giant at risk of investigations & hefty fines https://t.co/8XEzIzf87E
With intimidation & surveillance, China tries to quash the most widespread protests seen in the country in decades https://t.co/b8ClXL6AWS

Musk laid off half the team at Twitter that was devoted to tackling child sexual exploitation on the platform. The team was already stretched prior to the cuts.

Last week he tweeted that “removing child exploitation is priority #1” 

🤔
 https://t.co/tYzRvOxwuc

Some of furniture giant Ikea's products were for years made using forced labor in Belarusian jails, report says. "Half of Ikea’s major Belarusian suppliers had links with penal colonies run by the authorities of Alexander Lukashenko" https://t.co/AtpolgZbWD
The current state of Twitter: "Multiple teams that were critical for keeping the service up and running are completely gone, or borrowing engineers from other groups" https://t.co/dJ9NCpC53A
“I know of six critical systems (like ‘serving tweets’ levels of critical) which no longer have any engineers" 👀 https://t.co/3dNqf4VR2Y

Intelligence collected from downed Iranian drones used by Russia in Ukraine shows majority of the aircrafts’ parts are manufactured by companies in the U.S., Europe & other allied nations https://t.co/WghEmgwkrN
This is wild https://t.co/Ao6JjArFOw

New: Elon Musk's lawyer has sought to reassure Twitter employees they won't go to jail if the company is found in violation of a Federal Trade Commission decree that outlines steps Twitter must take to protect users’ personal data. With @KurtWagner8  https://t.co/i81hImYEFd

So many big resignations at Twitter in the last 72 hrs

- chief information security officer
- chief privacy officer
- chief compliance officer
- head of integrity & safety 
- director of software engineering

Hard to overstate the scale of the crisis the company is now facing
Apple limits AirDrop wireless file-sharing feature on iPhones in China after the mechanism was used by protesters to spread images to other iPhone owners https://t.co/uFuNpvmj13

Report says large investors in Elon Musk's Twitter deal -- like Saudi & Qatar -- have confidential agreements that spell out potential roles & how much access they get to internal company info  https://t.co/qbFely0RtR
US senator calls for security review of Saudi investment in Twitter: https://t.co/RQ0ehzQewO
Documents detail inner workings of the Russian war machine. Brilliant reporting https://t.co/nTsVWKleKc
There's not been enough scrutiny of the fact that Elon Musk's Twitter takeover has been propped up with cash from Qatar & Saudi Arabia https://t.co/lPhIp6Qw9j

Hackers who breached a UK water company accessed a control system for ultraviolet treatment of drinking water at a facility that processes 32m gallons daily & serves 200k people. Unclear if they had the ability to contaminate supply; alarming either way https://t.co/CyLkrErF7p

Russia using combination of cyberattacks & physical intimidation in effort to seize parts of Ukraine's internet infrastructure, CEO of Ukrtelecom tells me. Says his employees sabotaged their own equipment to prevent Russia using it in occupied territories: https://t.co/FjHyUlnbAw

New: I spoke with some of the hackers & dissidents waging a covert war of sabotage against the authoritarian regimes of Belarus's Lukashenko & Russia's Putin. They are setting a new model for revolutionary groups. Here's their story: https://t.co/8KGiwnHOVR

New: US technology company Sandvine has quietly exited the Russian market after making major deals there in recent years to supply deep packet inspection equipment, a controversial technology that can be used to censor the internet: https://t.co/XBG64ZOB4D

Notorious hacking group Sandworm, linked to Russia's GRU spy agency, attempted cyberattack on Ukraine's electricity system, sought to take energy infrastructure offline last week in effort that was thwarted, security researchers & Ukrainian officials say: https://t.co/FQNZQ3Jqwc

German spyware firm FinFisher, notorious for its work helping authoritarian governments hack phones & computers, has shut down & filed for insolvency amid an investigation that was probing its alleged unlawful sales to Turkey: https://t.co/jCeYFIzJ7X

Two UK publishers censored books intended for western readers so they could be printed cheaply in China. Deleted references to Taiwan, Hong Kong & dissident artist Ai Weiwei. The 1st evidence that some books sold in west amended to satisfy Beijing: https://t.co/IhVtiqJezY

A group of Anonymous hacktivists say they accessed 100s of surveillance camera feeds in Russia & inserted anti-war messages onto some of them in an effort to "wake some of the civilians up, & urge them to fight back" https://t.co/l97UcJtMT6

US company Cloudflare provides its services to several Russian propaganda & disinfo websites, including one said to be covertly operated by the GRU intelligence agency. Company defying Ukrainian pressure, says it'll continue to serve its Russian customers. https://t.co/ahh4ou4ojF

Bloomberg News will temporarily suspend the work of its journalists inside Russia after President Vladimir Putin signed legislation that criminalizes independent reporting in the country  https://t.co/HcJwdqYYNZ

If you have friends or family in Russia having problems accessing blocked websites they may be able to bypass the censorship by using the Tor browser: 
https://t.co/FRvvF581Xp (Russian) 

https://t.co/65DOiPoPTw (English)

Mirror: https://t.co/ovMaaiX5hK

Forbes walking back its report that Russian billionaire Alisher Usmanov's yacht was seized in Germany. Seems it's not been seized but requires some kind of customs permit to leave Hamburg & it's not clear whether that permit will be granted. https://t.co/Umq8mTO7eV

New: Ukraine cybersecurity official says 400,000 volunteers have signed up to aid country's makeshift hacker unit, says volunteers working to gather intelligence & attack Russian military systems: https://t.co/KLf8Ubnluu
Assassination attempts on Zelensky thwarted by leaks from anti-war elements within Russia’s Federal Security Service, says Ukraine security official https://t.co/Hlp1vCtdrN

Some good research here from @CheckpointSW pointing to some supposed hacktivist groups that have made false claims about breaches (on Yandex & Russian nuclear institute) -- in fact what they're doing is just repacking publicly available info. https://t.co/trpXpn7Php
Good piece from @WilliamTurton on the "fog of cyberwar": https://t.co/JKuGZaPIY0

New: I spoke to the CEO of US tech co Epam -- which employs more than 30k people in Ukraine, Russia & Belarus -- about claims from workers he's been soft on Russia & the crisis he says his company is now facing: https://t.co/RpqGCQVfzY

Russian official says cyberattacks on country’s satellites a “cause for war,” while denying control center taken down by hackers. Warning follows unverified claims from pro-Ukraine hacktivist group that it shut down space agency's satellite operations. https://t.co/lm5y53vTIn

France seizes giant yacht owned by @RosneftEN CEO Igor Sechin. Customs officials took control of the "Amore Vero" overnight in the Mediterranean port of La Ciotat, near Marseille, as it was preparing an urgent departure: https://t.co/K5IYEoQVj8

New: Dissension inside US tech company Epam over company's stance on Ukraine. Contractor says he was blocked from accessing Epam computer systems after urging top execs to condemn Russia & provide resources to support a makeshift Ukrainian “cyber army”: https://t.co/6uDig8lxYQ

A disturbing review of the Orwellian nightmare that is Russian state TV news, broadcasting an alternative reality in which Ukraine is bombing its own cities & there is no war taking place, just a "demilitarisation operation" https://t.co/nO1FBrwJJJ

Credit Suisse asks hedge funds & other investors to destroy documents relating to its richest clients’ yachts & private jets, in attempt to stop info leaking about bank unit that made loans to oligarchs who were later sanctioned: https://t.co/1FnWHYWflw

Ukrainian man gets arrested for partially sinking €7 million yacht owned by Russian weapons dealer on Spanish island. Tells judge: "I don't regret anything I've done & I'd do it again." He's now left the island to fight in Ukraine, local media report. https://t.co/dzsSuoAUOr
Microsoft president describes "offensive & destructive cyberattacks directed against Ukraine’s digital infrastructure" in hours prior to Russia's invasion: https://t.co/J8XGaGYJdQ
"This is arguably one of the biggest shifts ever seen in Germany's post-war foreign policy." https://t.co/O2Le4kC5Ct

Electric vehicle charging stations in Russia hacked, disabled, & made to display anti-Putin messages; Ukrainian company that provided parts for the chargers allegedly exploited backdoor in control systems. https://t.co/UyidID5uOr

Anonymous hackers claimed breach of Russian state media outlet TASS & other Russian news orgs earlier today. Websites were defaced with an anti-war message calling for Russian citizens to take to the streets in protest. Was pretty swiftly deleted; TASS is back online now https://t.co/QcMuPlElIB

New: Belarus hacktivist group  @cpartisans staged a new cyberattack on the country's train network today in effort to disrupt Russian troop movements into Ukraine. Group damaged railway control system, claims trains were halted in Minsk, Orsha & Osipovichi https://t.co/ExGc81v7He

Putin reportedly has a $97 million luxury yacht called "Graceful". A group of Anonymous hackers on Saturday figured out a way to mess with maritime traffic data & made it look like the yacht had crashed into Ukraine's Snake Island, then changed its destination to "hell": https://t.co/Ch53lcG7D6

New: I spoke to Ukrainians who say they have formed a makeshift "cyberwar" unit & are working with Ukraine's government to stage hacks on Russian officials & websites amid the ongoing invasion: https://t.co/w5ieE4t2xU
New: I wrote about the terrifying rise of "zero click" hacks - a method of breaking into a smartphone or computer even if its user doesn’t open a malicious link or attachment. https://t.co/ATo8vGrCOx

New: Twitter cutting ties to European tech company Mitto after our investigation revealing Mitto co-founder operated a service that helped governments secretly spy on mobile phones. Twitter informed Senator @RonWyden of its decision last week. https://t.co/SxqWKCvS51

New: Russia-linked ransomware gang "Black Cat" allegedly behind the hacks that took down a swath of Germany’s fuel-distribution system this week & hindered payments at some filling stations, say people familiar with the breaches: https://t.co/ybsBCajwXl

New: Google told US lawmaker it received a warning last May that European technology company Mitto was “siphoning” user passcodes to aid surveillance carried out by foreign governments: https://t.co/7FbsB5wFLz

Belarusian hacktivist group the Cyber Partisans says it's trying to disrupt Russian troop movements into Belarus amid Ukraine tensions, breached the state-owned company that runs Belarus's train network & rendered its systems inaccessible w/ ransomware: https://t.co/OM53McUB0T

Polish opposition senator was hacked with NSO spyware during campaign against government in 2019, his text messages stolen then doctored in a smear campaign aired on state-controlled TV: https://t.co/LYIuupUKsP

Good profile of accused ransomware hacker Yaroslav Vasinskyi, the "quiet & friendly" student who went on to become an alleged affiliate of the notorious REvil gang -- & now facing extradition to US: https://t.co/O1kVkdjKKb

"NSO has been spending heavily to build up drone-monitoring technology & a big-data analytics platform that executives are pitching as key assets in discussions with two US-based funds that have expressed interest in acquiring the company" https://t.co/kxNiBCv8dd

The Kremlin's internet censorship system is reportedly powered in part by servers from US company Super Micro & "traffic analysis solutions" developed by a division of US firm Keysight Technologies: https://t.co/Qp8mPqEEV6

"Australia's intelligence agencies determined that China’s spy services were behind the breach, having infiltrated the ranks of Huawei technicians who helped maintain the equipment and pushed the update to the telecom’s systems." https://t.co/me2PLk7pJQ

New: Facebook parent Meta Platforms Inc. announces sweeping crackdown on surveillance companies that it says have used its social media websites to "indiscriminately" spy on people in more than 100 countries. https://t.co/RLPZumMkFu

Huawei documents reveal company pitching  technologies to help government authorities "identify individuals by voice, monitor political individuals of interest, manage ideological reeducation & labor schedules for prisoners" https://t.co/rWomL2JGxI

US lawmakers call for Magnitsky sanctions against Israeli spyware firm NSO Group & three other foreign surveillance companies (DarkMatter, Nexa & Trovicor) which they say helped authoritarian governments commit human rights abuses. https://t.co/cHdLFlM81h

New: Google employees have joined the slew of politicians & activists blasting the internet giant for pulling a voting app from Russia’s opposition leader @Navalny, a move critics say showed the company was caving in to the Kremlin. https://t.co/Nb2B9uMEVV

Wrote about an extraordinary ongoing hacking campaign in Belarus by a group called the "Cyber Partisans", which has breached dozens of police & government databases in recent months in a bid to expose wrongdoing & overthrow the Lukashenko regime https://t.co/NbXBsBALqi

With the Taliban now in control of Afghanistan it's worth considering what will happen now to the internet censorship & surveillance technology companies like @Sandvine provided the country in recent years; there's huge scope for abuse https://t.co/tcJQmC4gCc https://t.co/zi5K6jLoqA
My team at @business is recruiting a reporter based in DC, a great opportunity for somebody who wants to do aggressive reporting & investigations on the cybersecurity beat: https://t.co/qs51LAt98J
US consultancy firm Berkeley Research Group lined up to take control of private equity fund that owns Israeli spyware maker NSO Group https://t.co/eiGM1EFDmM

Chinese govt-sponsored hackers in alleged years-long campaign compromising telcos in South East Asia, stealing phone records, location data, obtaining "holy grail of espionage,” researchers say https://t.co/lwB4ClaVYQ
Iranian-state linked hackers disguised themselves as a flirty aerobics instructor from Liverpool in an effort to hack US defence contractor https://t.co/qIRi3CHbz6

Inside China's largest detention center. “We’re moving from a police state to a mass incarceration state. Hundreds of thousands of people have disappeared from the population." https://t.co/8PvUJ8i4DH
The UK govt a few yrs ago showed it was a responsible "cyber actor" by hacking EU companies like Belgacom & Gemalto 🙃 https://t.co/hWKfW69oiq https://t.co/mxo7fE4NF5

Facebook content moderators in Europe & US criticise company's "excessive secrecy," call for end to nondisclosure agreements that discourage them from speaking out about working conditions https://t.co/PzAyLxpkHG
Clearest piece I've read yet on the recent NSO revelations & what the stories do & don't reveal, from the indefatigable @KimZetter https://t.co/fLDVrjHInR

The NSO story has taken an interesting turn, with the company now saying the leaked target phone numbers are not from NSO or its Pegasus spyware & that a broker was shopping the numbers round  while falsely claiming an NSO server in Cyprus was hacked https://t.co/vWZoFvrL6T https://t.co/scU9gVlOSk

UK journalists "could be treated like spies" for reporting on government secrets & face up to 14 years jail, with no public interest defence, under planned reform to Official Secrets Act https://t.co/nzUDUmOPV6

Leak identifies 50,000 phone numbers associated with people who were potential targets of spyware sold by NSO Group. List includes journalists, lawyers, business executives, religious figures, academics, NGO employees, top govt officials. https://t.co/bkoNMIB7G1

Google CEO Sundar Pichai warning that internet freedom "is being attacked" .... strangely omitting mention of his own plan a few years ago to create a censored version of Google in China that would block search results for phrases like "human rights"🤔 https://t.co/pMw9sgKZJE

New: Former employees at US tech firm Kaseya told us they tried to raise alarm repeatedly about internal security failings before the recent hack of the company's software that led to one of the worst ever ransomware incidents https://t.co/9cH3q7cgXx
Apple accused of blocking access to dozens of LGBTQ+ related apps in China, Saudi Arabia, Sub-Saharan Africa: https://t.co/YuDu8nxBsw

Pretty wild to see the CTO of US tech company @Sandvine, which sells internet censorship equipment, openly applauding Russian government internet blocking & bandwidth throttling in this post on LinkedIn from Friday https://t.co/z5Wc5eWp3l https://t.co/kHfmtPCkU0
Apple won't offer new private web browsing feature in countries including China, Belarus, Saudi Arabia https://t.co/1g992zk7HV

Strange statement from JBS on ransomware breach. Says it paid $11m to hackers, but had already recovered systems before doing so. Detected no compromise of data, but paid ransom to protect customers. 🤔 https://t.co/B9KiWPAVCQ

Spoke to ex-employees at meat processing giant JBS, which shut down some operations last week due to ransomware. They described lax cybersecurity & said execs didn't prioritise protecting the company's computer infrastructure b/c it was seen as too costly. https://t.co/vcl0daAtvF
Twitter complies with Indian govt request to block accounts that voiced support for farmers staging protests https://t.co/Eq8caJxQk7

This is a fascinating case. FBI & Australian cops secretly controlled an encrypted app called AN0M, duped high-profile criminal figures into vouching for its security, then monitored messages of its users, ensnaring alleged drug cartels & triad gangs  https://t.co/fgWcpREU4G
Microsoft's @Bing appears to censor images of "tank man" on the 32nd anniversary of the Tiananmen square massacre https://t.co/EzdxnGZSpy
UK companies face pressure over links to Belarus regime https://t.co/7C7VMySKoE
Denmark accused of helping US spy on European officials: https://t.co/RK9Sap756Q

Belarus govt claimed it forced @Ryanair plane carrying dissident journalist to land in Minsk due to a bomb threat....but the threat was actually sent 24 minutes *after* the plane was diverted🤔 https://t.co/sSFVESl15c

I wrote about the encrypted messaging app Signal & some of the internal issues unconventional CEO Moxie Marlinspike has been navigating amid surging popularity & endorsements from the likes of Elon Musk: https://t.co/b1XJZjRFcH
Google urged to abandon cloud computing project in Saudi Arabia over human rights concerns https://t.co/3shNcI7UE5

Crazy story out of Belarus today. @Ryanair passenger plane flying from Greece to Lithuania diverted to Minsk while traveling over Belarus. Appears Belarus govt issued fake bomb threat to bring down the plane & arrest an exiled journalist who was on board. https://t.co/N7XpRuAqqj

The ransomware attack affecting Ireland's hospitals is horrendous. Some cancer patients’ consultations cancelled, radiology & diagnostic systems disrupted. Now hackers - a suspected Russian crime group - threatening release of patient data if not paid $20m https://t.co/aAjvyXYUe4

Some great reporting here on Apple's presence in China & its compliance with govt censorship & surveillance in the country. From banning apps about the Dalai Lama & Tiananmen to handing over user data to a state-owned company. 😱 https://t.co/HZBVIRLJk6

New: LinkedIn froze account of UK-based China critic & removed content criticizing the country’s "repressive dictatorship." Also blocked the account of a @HRW employee, making it invisible to people in China, citing "prohibited content." https://t.co/CeNWaWmIS7

Our investigation of US surveillance camera company Verkada. Current & former employees describe “bro culture”, harassment of women, alcohol & drug use in the office, misleading marketing claims, & lax security standards that led to a massive recent hack: https://t.co/mT4KeOmIAB
Saudi aid worker Abdulrahman al-Sadhan reportedly sentenced to 20 years in prison https://t.co/ItYKSYrII2

Microsoft investigating possibility Chinese state-sponsored hackers compromised a Taiwanese security research firm & stole a zero-day exploit that they used to breach Microsoft Exchange email servers worldwide https://t.co/AXgVcHJUi8

Some interesting technical details on how the Russian govt is disrupting Twitter's link redirection service https://t.co/H213SyC91j. At first it botched the effort & also throttled access to Russian state news outlet https://t.co/AmnHnJSVgG as well🤦 https://t.co/I5CyiQriUo

Swiss police raid apartment of hacker who breached security camera company @VerkadaHQ. Raid related to US investigation of a different alleged hack that took place last year & cryptocurrency holdings, search warrant shows. https://t.co/qgwBl8htFc

Workers at US security camera startup @VerkadaHQ had extensive access to private customer footage, could peer into global corporations, schools & police departments, former employees told @WilliamTurton & me: https://t.co/peFmwAqG2o

Pretty incredible that just two days after blaming China for a massive hack of its exchange servers worldwide, Microsoft still went ahead & announced a major expansion of its cloud services in China https://t.co/QABBljOWWe

Coalition of rights groups including @accessnow, @amnesty & @RSF_inter join Facebook's legal fight against the Israeli spy tech company NSO Group, arguing that the “very core of the principles that America represents” are at stake in the case: https://t.co/XDgAZDHvLc
it's been a terrible year & everyone is stressed so here's some photos of red squirrels I saw this morning in Scotland 😍 https://t.co/kwoYtSROjn
Incredible https://t.co/CaNFhaRKl2

New: Tech from US company @Sandvine used to censor the internet in more than a dozen countries w/ a record of political repression. We've uncovered Sandvine's deals w/ likes of Algeria, Azerbaijan, Egypt, Eritrea, Sudan, Thailand, Turkey, UAE & Uzbekistan: https://t.co/tcJQmC4gCc
